decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. It aims to control the game with powerful colorless spells and threats like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck can lock down the opponent's threats with Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust, while also having access to powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck's consistency comes from cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces like Tron lands and threats.

The key concept of this UR Control deck is to slow down and disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck utilizes cards like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Snapcaster Mage to control the board while also using Madcap Experiment to cheat out Platinum Emperion as a win condition. Blood Moon is included as a disruptive element, turning off nonbasic lands and disrupting mana bases. The deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the opponent's draws and prevent them from playing their key cards by using cards such as Ensnaring Bridge, Lantern of Insight, and Codex Shredder. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck utilizes artifacts like Mox Opal and Whir of Invention to assemble its combo pieces quickly. The inclusion of cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Witchbane Orb helps to disrupt specific strategies while ensuring the control player's victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck, allowing you to win the game with Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck relies on fast mana generation through cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, as well as control elements like Pact of Negation to protect the combo. The deck also includes cantrips like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions to dig for the combo pieces and lands that produce all colors of mana to ensure you can cast your spells.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Thought-Knot Seer to strip away key cards from their hand, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Flickerwisp. The deck also aims to control the opponent's mana base through cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter, while also having the potential to lock them out of the game entirely with Aether Vial and Eldrazi Displacer. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive, making it difficult for opponents to execute their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly burn through the opponent's life total by utilizing efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By consistently dealing damage directly to the opponent with cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide provide early pressure, while Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes the opponent for playing spells. This aggressive playstyle aims to close out the game as quickly as possible.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and using land synergy to generate card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence with creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Tireless Tracker, while also disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Aven Mindcensor and Path to Exile. Utilizing cards like Collected Company and Ramunap Excavator, the deck is able to maximize the value of its lands and creatures, creating a fast and powerful aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on playing efficient spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying powerful threats like Death's Shadow to quickly close out the game. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand and Fatal Push and Terminate to remove threats, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and finish them off with big creatures like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow. With a low land count and a high density of spells, the deck is designed to be aggressive and disruptive in the early turns of the game.

This deck is designed to quickly ramp up mana using the Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt opponent's strategies. With a mix of early aggression and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful threats and efficient mana base, making it a formidable Aggro deck in the Modern format.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Humans deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature strategy. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant, Champion of the Parish, and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent with cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. With the help of Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat creatures into play and make them uncounterable, the deck looks to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building up infect counters on the opponent to win the game. By using efficient creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf alongside pump spells like Groundswell and Might of Old Krosa, the deck aims to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent before they can stabilize. Protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing help to protect the key creatures from removal or disruption, allowing the combo to execute smoothly and effectively. The deck optimizes speed and efficiency to overwhelm opponents with infect damage.

This deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as quickly as possible. The key strategy is to use efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to deal damage directly to the opponent while also utilizing creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at their life total. The deck also includes cards like Skullcrack and Boros Charm to prevent the opponent from gaining life or disrupting your game plan. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main goal of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using the Amulet of Vigor to cheat out powerful threats like Primeval Titan. By utilizing land bounce effects and extra land drop abilities, the deck can generate huge amounts of mana in just a few turns, allowing it to play game-ending threats ahead of schedule. The deck also includes utility lands and removal spells to deal with opposing threats, while also having some counter magic for protection. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to assemble the pieces needed to play Primeval Titan as quickly as possible and overwhelm the opponent with powerful lands and creatures.

The deck focuses on ramping mana quickly to assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift. By sacrificing lands with Scapeshift, the player can search for Valakut and multiple Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to their opponent. The deck also includes ways to control the board and generate card advantage, while utilizing powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Huntmaster of the Fells to apply pressure. The key to winning with this deck is to efficiently ramp up to the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of burn damage.

The deck aims to quickly play Death's Shadow by lowering their own life total with cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize. It uses cards like Fatal Push and Terminate to control the board while disrupting the opponent's strategy with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek. Snapcaster Mage allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in using spells from the graveyard. The deck also has counterspells like Stubborn Denial to protect its threats, and can finish off opponents quickly with cards like Temur Battle Rage.

This deck focuses on efficiently tutoring for specific creatures using Eldritch Evolution to create powerful synergies. It includes a variety of creatures with different abilities that can disrupt opponents' strategies and generate value, such as Eternal Witness and Restoration Angel. The deck also contains a Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker combo for a potential game-winning play. By utilizing creatures like Renegade Rallier and Kitchen Finks, this toolbox deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo finish. The mana base supports the diverse casting requirements of the creatures in the deck.
